name: Heat Metal
description: Choose a manufactured metal object you can see within range (weapon, armor, etc.). It glows red-hot. A creature holding or wearing the object takes 2d8 fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again. If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes damage, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can; if it doesnâ€™t drop it, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.
higherLevels: When cast with a slot of 3rd level or higher, damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

components.materialDescription: a piece of iron and a flame

effects.description: Initial heating deals 2d8 fire to the holder/wearer (if any).
Bonus action each turn to repeat the damage on the same object.
If a creature takes this damage while holding/wearing the object, it must Con save or drop it if possible; otherwise it has disadvantage on attacks and ability checks until your next turn.
